intro: Hibbertia densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. Hibbertia densiflora produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, making it visually distinctive. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to thrive in well-drained environments.
